Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: blackpoolwhenimsixty
Reviews.Content: Needed a budget sleep in central London and booked at short notice. The room was shoddy and dirty with worn furniture and fittings and had a damp smell. The bathroom ( if you can call it that) was filthy and mould and stains on the fittings - don't stay here if you value your health!

Reviews.Title: “My stay on 13/02/12”
Reviews.Author: badsworth
Reviews.Content: Good points: £38.25 (including agency fees) for a one night stay in a London hotel in Belgrave (including continental breakfast) must be pretty exceptional for 2011. Also, the staff did have the decency to look pretty embarrassed about everything else that happened below:- Bad Points: when I arrived I noticed that the entire ground floor smelt of curry, whilst my room which was on the top floor (six flights of stairs - no lift) smelt of ' armpits'. The bedroom was slightly bigger than the double bed which was covered in a sheet and light quilt but no duvet. The room was cramped, dirty and dishevelled. The bed linen was far from inspiring. The window was not double glazed and very draughty. The radiator was functioning at approximately 10% capacity and the room was freezing. I realised that the smell of armpits was due to the fact that all previous occupants had probably slept in their clothes. The ensuite shower room (ha ha!) Was also unheated, dirty and mouldy. The toilet paper was actually stored in the wardrobe in the main bedroom because there was not room in the tiny shower room for a loo roll dispenser. I went to bed at around 10 PM having donned several spare layers of clothing and decided to chance the rather dubious looking spare blanket which resided on top of the flimsy (sub MFI) wardrobe. At around 2.30 a.m I became aware of a commotion outside the door to my room involving a number of excited residents. I was unable to decide if the door knocking was in respect of my own room or other residents of the same floor as each of the doorways were so close together and I decided not to answer my door. At 3.15 a.m. I heard a key in the door to my room and the night Porter entered in his nightclothes. He explained (in very broken English) that he had been sleeping on the floor in reception and that water had been flowing down the walls and over the fax machine due to an overflow. He thought it started in my room. He flushed the toilet in my ensuite several times and seemed to apologise for the intrusion. I tried to go back to sleep. At 3.45 a.m. my door opened again (this time with only one knock) to reveal three Asian gentlemen armed with a screwdriver who seemed to want to inspect my ensuite toilet once again. At this time they did not seem to find any problems with my toilet and left my bedroom after saying a number of things which I did not understand. At 7.00 a.m. I got up after the coldest and most interrupted night I have ever experienced in any country to discover that there was not only no heating in my room but also no heating of the hot water in the shower (there was tepid water available in the sink). I had to shower in ice-cold water and decided to skip the continental breakfast! Finally, I just have to say that I am afraid that this hotel provided the worst nights accommodation I have ever experienced in anycountry - at least in backpackers hostels in southern Europe you do not have too wear your clothes to bed!

Reviews.Title: “You are in London! So...!”
Reviews.Author: zxa42
Reviews.Content: I’m always traveling on a tight budget. Before departure, I search a lot to manage my money to get the best quality from the lowest money spending. Before leaving to London I searched many sites and read reviews. With all bad reviews about Park Hotel lastly I decided to stay here for 2 nights for the following reasons: 1. Many of London’s sightseeing are in walking distance. So, I saved for transportation cost. 2. I was leaving hotel in the morning and coming back late night. What I wanted was a basic breakfast, clean bed, clean toilet and hot shower which was included the rate. 3. I traveled in January when is off-season and hotel offered me a good price (29 Pound per night for ensuit room and basic breakfast) Luckily my room was a double bed. Still small and old but I could move! Hotel has a wireless internet zone but I didn’t use. If you stay here remember: 1. I saw the pictures of other guests some rooms were very shady. My room was 219. It was ok compared to those pictures. But window was broken and I cut my finger while trying to shut it. Finally, I couldn’t! 2. Ask the reception to switch on the heater at night. 3. My room doesn’t have cooling system. So for summer might be a problem 4. I saw some scary pictures of other guests here in Trip Advisor bit by bedbugs. I didn’t see any. They were not around because of winter!? 5. When open the tap in the shower room be patient! Hot water will come after 10 minutes! 6. Hotel doesn’t have lift and stairs are narrow. 7. Hotel runs by 2 staff. One is reception and one is multifunction! 8. During the pick-season rates increase up to 66 Pound to 160 Pound! Unbelievable! But I think other hotels also increase their price! So still Park Hotel will be cheaper. 9. I saw about 50 B&B in Belgrave and Warwick area. But all look same size and same quality. If one of them is a bit better in service then the price will increase. 10. Definitely, owner knows about many deficiencies in his hotel but also he knows travelers can not find a cheaper hotel in London. So, why to spend money for improving it!? 11. Don’t miss the Cypriot/Turkish restaurant in Warwick 5 min by walk from Park hotel. And finally: 12. If this hotel was in another city I was giving much lower rate to this property. .

Reviews.Title: “budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: amit4717
Reviews.Content: This hotel is budget hotel in central london.The room was not great but was manageable.Booked the hotel over internet because of the location. The hotel room was all sold off so i had to stay in standard room.

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL EVER”
Reviews.Author: abm1970 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel i have ever stayed at. the ceiling had been badly re-plastered after what looked like a water leak the carpet was filthy and was covered in staines the bathroom was filthy and full of mould after i complained i was told they were full and had no other rooms available and that i wouldnt get a refund. i recommend everyone give this hotel a miss as its filthy and the owners just want your money and dont care about you

Reviews.Title: “Dont expect a spacious place to unwind”
Reviews.Author: kraor
Reviews.Content: This is an older hotel on Belgrave Road close to Victoria Station. This is more of a budget hotel which attracts more the 'Backpack Crowd'. The rooms are very small make you feel like you're in a jail cell.The rooms have a shower/bathroom ,television,closet,coffee & tea maker. The room was fairly clean with complementary breakfast served between 7:00-9:30 hr. which consist of cereal,toast & jam ,juice. The hotel is nothing fancy just a budget place to wash up then rest your head yet that's it.

Reviews.Title: “Awful- smell & bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: marie-ann p
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my friend & our two children (room 11). The smell in the bathroom meant we had to sleep with the windows open in October which was cold and very, very noisy! They had no other rooms and told me I could go to every court for a refund as they wouldn't refund. My friend and her daughter were covered in bites from the bedding and when I went down to complain at 07.30am the night manager was asleep on the breakfast room floor (unsightly and against health & safety & hygiene regulations). We didn't even stay for breakfast as we wouldn't chance it. DON'T STAY HERE AVOID!

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience of a hotel EVER”
Reviews.Author: Sharon R
Reviews.Content: We were a little perturbed on arrived when told we could not have a refund even if we didn't like the room. Our fears were realised when we opened our door to find the room in a complete state. The room had not been cleaned or sheets changed......the room had been trashed by the previous occupants, the bed was in a pile of sheets, there was a great deal of rubbish every where, and the toilet...well to be polite...was covered in poo. In addition the room smelt disgusting. On complaint we were told the room would be cleaned within the hour. After arguement and treat of trading standards, we finally got our money back. Please do not use this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it to yourself!”
Reviews.Author: Julie Y
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband go to London every year and depending on what weâ€™re doing we stay near to a tube line that gets us where we wanna go. This time we paid a little more than we usually do. We wanted a hotel a little nicer than the 3 other hotels in central London we had stayed in previous years. All of which were not nearly as terrible as this one. When we arrived and opened the door to our room I was gob smacked. Plaster stains all over the carpet the overall feel of the room was grubby and as I put down my case and turned around I realised half the ceiling was missing. This room was not fit for guests in my opinion. Please for your own sake â€“ book someplace else!!!!

Reviews.Title: “NOT GOOD”
Reviews.Author: KATH H
Reviews.Content: We booked on-line and when we got there, we were asked to pay in cash as their credit card machine had broken. When we said credit card or nothing, the machine miraculously worked. The room had 2 double beds, a tad overcrowded, and was reasonably clean, although the shower tray was very shallow and we had to unblock the plughole so it would not overflow. The sink had no plug. The kettle had no back on the electric plug and the tv plugged into an extension cable with very dodgy wiring. There was no remote for the tv and so this was completely inoperable. The continental breakfast was juice, cerials and toast. On the the bright side, we paid just Â£72 for a hotel in the middle of London and so if you don't touch the electrics and are prepared to do a bit of cleaning and diy, you might consider it value for money. Definately don't stay for longer than one night. Plenty of local pubs, real beer and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS!!! DON'T GO HERE!”
Reviews.Author: Eva A
Reviews.Content: My friend and I arrived at the hotel this friday night at around 1 am. The hotel was obviously low-budget, and we know that price is relative to quality at times so I guess we weren't expecting top notch quality.. BUT to witness a hotel being run under such poor hygiene standards is just absolutely shocking. Firstly, the room was awful; extractor fan on the window which had been stuck together by tape essentially, a carpet and bed cover which were absolutely hideous, shoddy electrics; my friend tried turning on the tv with a remote, as you do of course, and that wouldn't work, so we then tried to turn the light switch off to go to bed and that turned out to be the trigger for the tv to turn on! BUT the worst part of it all BY FAR was the number of BED BUGS we found, and the reaction/"damage control" of the staff.. We found bed bugs of all sizes, from small undeveloped ones, to ones who have bitten people before (we then discovered they grow with the more blood they have). We squished a few and saw the blood coming out as we did.. was as gross as it sounds, and to be honest i don't know how this hotel still operates under those circumstances... anyway I then proceeded to making a complaint to reception, and demanded a full refund. Person at reception dealt with this terribly, as he actually said we would have to wait till the nxt day to talk to the manager, even though he admitted from the very first second that yes, they have been having problems with bed bugs. In fact his reaction to my question of whether they had beg bugs was: "What room are you in?" Very reassuring what can I say!! Anyway after a long conversation and a lot of frustration later, we decided to take his offer of a different room as my friend and I were exhausted and didn't know where else to go. BUT no that didn't work either; that had BED BUGS as well!!! Absolutely horrific place DO NOT GO!

Reviews.Title: “Imagine a hotel run by Basil Fawlty and built by Frank Spencer”
Reviews.Author: deanfp
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot to the UK and if I have not booked ahead I usually stay in a hotel like this. Sometimes they have been good, sometimes bad. This one was terrible. I arrived at around 4pm and was greeted by a rude young person who kept yelling thing to me twice. Not sure why but each to their own. I asked if I could purchase the 1 week Wi-Fi and he said that I could but couldnt. Whatever that meant... I took my suitcases up three flights of narrow stairs. Noticed the dried chewing gum on the carpets and the growing mould up the walls. Passed a smelly shared toilet that despite having an "Out of Order" sign on was open and unclean. Finally made it to my room. The first thing I noticed was no wardrobe to hang clothes. Yet much to my surprise I found four coat hangers on the toilet chain. So at least I had somewhere to hang my clothes! The "Tea and coffee making facilites" was comprised of a kettle that didn't work, and out of date dried coffee and tea amongst toe nail clippings and hair. The bed was hard, had one flimsy blanket and two lumpy pillows. The window was cracked, did not open and also had mould on the broken wooden frame. The TV did not work but the best was the bathroom. Hanging my towel on the plastic rail, it came off. The sink had no hot water, the shower took 45 minutes to drain and when I sat on the toilet my knees hit the sink. In my 4 night stay my towels were not changed once and on the second day I found them on the bathroom floor. A terrible hotel that I would not suggest staying in unless you really are desperate.

Reviews.Title: “Cancelled reservation more than 60 days prior to stay, still charged for room”
Reviews.Author: cambrdigetraveller
Reviews.Content: Booked a room. Afterwards sent three emails cancelling reservation. All of the emails were at least 30 days prior to the scheduled say. The first was 60 days prior to the stay. The hotel still charged one night stay despite cancellation policy. Do not trust this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect cheap and cheerful hotel”
Reviews.Author: alan_meyrick
Reviews.Content: Reading the reviews around on this place I was truly apprehensive about staying here, but for Â£44 a night for 2 people in central London I thought I'd give it a go. The hotel is basic, but I was in London, I wanted to explore London not stay in my hotel room. Lots of people on here and other sites complain that the stairs are steep (they are, it's an old London house), the rooms are small (they're compact, but if you want bigger pay more), the bathrooms are small (it's just a bathroom you don't spend that much time in there). In summary this hotel has the best location and value I've ever had in London and I've visited a lot! If you want somewhere to sleep and base yourself to explore London stay here, if you want a 5 star hotel with a huge room stay at the ritz!

Reviews.Title: “Bad Idea to book this hotel”
Reviews.Author: lifto1
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through a company called Easy to Book , I was told on the morning of my stay that there had been a double booking and that I would need to find other accomodation. My credit card was charged and I was advised to contact the Hotel to get a refund. I have been trying to get a credit card refund for 5 weeks, and made 7 phone calls to the hotel accounts department. I would advise you not to engage in any kind of financial transaction with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The only good thing about this hotel is the location!”
Reviews.Author: TaylorVegas
Reviews.Content: I don't even know where to begin with this s.... hit hole of a 'hotel' all the staff that work there are extremely rude. The location is the only good thing about this place. We arrived after a 26 hour flight to be crammed into a small shoebox room (it was suppose to be a triple room) we were on the top floor which meant we had to carry our suitcases up about 7 flights of stairs, the staff didn't even bother to show us our room or help with our luggage. The bathroom is an even smaller shoebox and smelt of mould. We ended up smoking in there cause the smell was nicer! The free wifi wasn't working the first day we arrived and we asked the rude indian at reception & he told us we had to call some company if we wanted it fixed (umm isn't that their job??) my 2 friends & I were backpacking around Europe so at the end of our eurotrip we had to come back to park hotel for a night since we were leaving from heathrow we were not looking forward to this return. When we came back 5 weeks later the wifi still wasn't working before we left we had requested a room on the bottom floor as we didn't want to carry our stuff up to the top floor again, the reception guy said we never asked him that even tho we had a full on convo with him. The breakfast was horrible. Just cereal, toast and horrible coffee. The lady washing the dishes just rinsed everything in cold water right in front of us. Also on our return in the same room we found all our magazines we bad left STILL under the bed. We have been all over Thailand, America and Europe and this is by far THE WORST 'hotel' we have EVER stayed in, I wouldn't even recommend this 'hotel' to my worst enemy. This piece of sh.. it needs to be closed down. It's an embarrassment to London. I would rather stab myself in the eye then have to come back. On out last day the hotel reception guy said he will book us a transfer to the airport so we paid it and the taxi driver asked us how much we paid. We told him the price and he said oh it should only be like 20 pound (I forget the price) but we ended up getting ripped off by about 30 pound. So the park hotel got the last laugh. Once again. If you want to have a bad time then I suggest you stay in one of the red phone booths around the corner. If I never have to cone back here it would be too soon!

Reviews.Title: “Rubbish.”
Reviews.Author: wferreira
Reviews.Content: Avoid it. Horrible receptionists, horrible rooms. Being stuck in a room beside de reception and having to walk from one place to another is outrageous. One wouldn't believe we could hear the receptionist farts as he slept in the reception area.

Reviews.Title: “Cancelled my booking after confirmation!!! AVOID”
Reviews.Author: mspiyali
Reviews.Content: I had booked the Park Hotel in May 2011 through their website. They even send me confirmation. I was travelling to Oxford for work and then planned to stay two days in London before I head back home! I was travelling with a colleague of mine and I supposedly had two confirmed single rooms in the hotel. I reconfirmed from Oxford two days before reaching London about the booking and they replied in positive. We reached Victoria Station and started looking for the hotel. After we are confused with the exact location, we called the reception at the Park Hotel. They simply informed that our booking has been cancelled and now they cannot help as they have no other rooms to give!!! Imagine being stranded at Central London with two suitcases and now where to go.!!! they were not even apologetic about their wrong doing. After checking out many hotels in Belgarve road, we finally got one. Apparently there was an important football match that day and being a weekend the hotels were giving rooms on a higher rate. No wonder the Park Hotel decided to cancel our booking which was done some time back on a lower rate. Both me and my colleague has to go through some serious harassment. before we landed in St George's Inn in Belgarve Road. The staff as St George's Inn were extreemly cordial and were our savior that day! I would never recommend The Park Hotel to anyone!!

Reviews.Title: “Not even rats would stay here”
Reviews.Author: runie01
Reviews.Content: This is by far the worst hotel i have ever seen or stayed in. When me and my girlfriend arrived on our first trip to the capital we were excited, until we saew the hotel, First of all we were booked in ddown the road at the Corbigoe but got moved to the Park Hotel.. why ? They wouldnt give us a reason. Then we got took to the basement of the park hotel in a tiny room with damp walls. There were LIVE cables sticking out of the walls behind the pillows on the bed and the tv was hanging off the wall. The bedding was filthy so we had to lay out our own towels to lay on as the filthy stained towels they provided looked like they were harbouring some sort of horrific disease ! Out of the window was a little courtyard where rubbish and rotting food was thrown and random people walking around at night. Every morning there was something going on in the corridor, lots of asian men banging around and just sitting outside the room staring, it really put us at unrest, we ended up taking all our valuables everywhere as they were not safe in that hell hole. The bathroom looked like it belonged in an aeroplane it was that small, there was mold and general filth all over the shower and sink. Then to top it all off, we arrived back after an amazing night at the theatre to sum dodgy man saying we havent payed the bill and we owed hundreds of pounds. I argued for about an hour and said i was calling the police, i had the number dialled then he changed his tune. We tried finding somewhere else but everywehre was full as it was New Years Eve (we genuinelly we scared for our safety that night) I stayed up all night just in case and could here someone outside the door and when i banged on the floor they ran up the stairs. NEVER EVER EVER stay at this hotel, it is an embarrasment to London and to England that this hellhole is allowed to stay open.

Reviews.Title: “don't go there!”
Reviews.Author: shoegirla
Reviews.Content: When I've checked in the guy at the front desk told me I have to pay in advance, gave him 100 pounds in cash, got the key... only when I got upstairs (very narrow, quite hard to carry a larger suitcase) did I realize he never gave me a receipt. Went downstairs asking for one and his reply was: Oh, do you need one? On Saturday morning before 8, the smoke alarm went off in my room only, nearly giving me a heart attack (was shaking for next 15 minutes!!) and of course I've strained my back when jumping out of bed. The alarm wouldn't stop until I've opened the door. After 5 minutes it started again, went downstairs only to see the light flickering and the electricians working away. Packed my bag and left. The worst experience ever! No apology, no explanations... there's hundred hotels in that area, AVOID this one!!!!

Reviews.Title: “is this surpose to be a hotel???????”
Reviews.Author: teresajones1
Reviews.Content: on arrival at the hotel they didnt have the room we asked for,,,,i phoned up & asked if they had a room wiv a bath & he said yes,,,,well thats funny because none of there rooms have baths,,,,we was escorted down the road to the corbridge hotel,,, ancient bed, dirty throws, set of draws was filthy, had to clean them before i could put my stuff in, only 3 clothes hangers in the boken waredrobe, bathroom was dirty, no toilet rollholder, no cup to put the toothbrushes in, shower was horrible,, if you didnt have a shower cap ur hair would get soaked, bathroom tiles was grimey, there was no where in the bathroom to put a thing,,,,not even your soap!!!!! no towels , i had to go & ask for them only to be told i was lucky to be getting 2,,,,no tea bags & wen i asked for sum the porter took them out of a carrier bag,,,i threw them in the bin,,,,,the night porter slept on the reception floor in his stripey pj's, we woke him up wen we got in at 12.20,, we had to ask for toilet rolls & when given some it was as if he was doing us a favour, we did have a balcony,,,the best part of the room, no key, we had to go & ask for it but he really didnt want to give it to us, then there was a bin full of rubbishout there & empty cans of beer, the blankets was covered in blonde & grey hairs,,,need i go on!!!!!...it was the worst hotel ive ever stayed in.....london was fab,,,this hotel was not!!!!!! i wouldnt recomend anyone stayed here,,,,i hated it.......

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: tourist1233445
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't recommend anyone go to this hotel, the service was a bismol, the front desk man was smoking and blew smoke in my face. He was also racist and very rude. Hotel itself was tiny and dirty. Hallways were so narrow, it may be difficult to maneuver with suitcases.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful affordable gem across from Hyde Park”
Reviews.Author: hippiedr
Reviews.Content: Considering the average price of a hotel is $200-$300. Park Hotel was a life saver. It is located in a posh area of London at Marble Arch. The room are clean and standard....a bit old and tired but fine. I took a single with hall bath which stayed clean. The maid cleaned the room daily. The staff could not have been nicer or more helpful. The morning breakfast was delightful. Keep this one in mind ... sks

Reviews.Title: “If you don't want to be abused do not get near these thieves and disgusting hotel”
Reviews.Author: mariolove1972m
Reviews.Content: I have booked double room 2 months in advance and I put a comment( WE HAVE GOT A BABY 6 MONTHS OLD WITH US) when we arrived as it was planned for it by the manager(OWNER) he told me that before you take your stuff in the room go have a look if you would like to stay in that room! when I have seen the room it was too small and very smelly even no space for our suitcase what about our baby???? I said to the manager the room is too small I asked him if he could change the room for us because we have no space for the baby but he refused and said to me get out ! he went very angry started shouting on me and my wife our baby scared started crying we asked him to calm down because of our baby but he shouted I don't care about your baby!!! ALL HE WANTED WE LEAVE THE HOTEL AND TAKE OUR MONEY, THAT'S WHAT HE DID WE HAD TO LEAVE THE HOTEL AND HE TOOK Â£48 FROM MY ACCOUNT, BEFORE WE LEAVE THE HOTEL THE MANAGER(OWNER) CALLED ME BA*****D, very professional!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “best hotel ever ever”
Reviews.Author: Timothy3
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here for 10 night. this is what I call money for value. do stay if you are looking for good location for good value

Reviews.Title: “Forget about comfort - choose Park Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Anjapro
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel amongst others as the opinions were not that negative and of course the location is advantageous. First our experience was even before the arrival, when I called to the reception to inform that we would be arriving late. The guy at the reception told me that there is no booking for my name! Luckily he was mistaken. We booked 2 rooms. In one of them there weren't a wardrobe to put our clothes. As we had a couple of business meeting and smart clothes to keep neat we had to hang them on a door, window and mirror. The rooms were so small! It was impossible to make a step without bumping into one another, suitcase or bed! Taking shower was quite an adventure, as we had to keep ourselves from being burnt or frozen. It was impossible to adjust normal temperature. The bathrooms were very small too. In the second room we had, the bathroom was so tiny that even a slim person couldn't turn around! As we arrived late we were really looking forward to having breakfast. It turned out that the reception area was also the place where the serve breakfast that comprised of toasts (with jam or butter), disgusting coffee, tea and cereals.One one of didn't get coffee for breakfast, so we asked for more. The got a strong reject as the breakfast time was over. It was chilly in the rooms and though we asked for an extra blanket, we didn't get one. The staff was not friendly at all!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money!! Highly recommended...”
Reviews.Author: Travel_2_explore84
Reviews.Content: I booked the room for two persons for my stay of 4 nights in the last week of January. After reading the reviews on internet, i was quite worried about my long planned holidays. But for my surprise, everything turned out wrong. The location of the hotel was excellent, rooms not that classy (as it was a B&B not a 3 star hotel) but they were worth for what i paid, Helpful and friendly staff, plain but unlimited breakfast. Overall it was satisfactory staying at park hotel. Thank you Park Hotel, we will definitely meet again. Alan Charles

Reviews.Title: “Dirty”
Reviews.Author: babyhk
Reviews.Content: I rejected the first room as carpet was hairy..human- and mattress stained. Second room cracked window and smelt like the worst nursing home imaginable. The receptionist was bewildered by my concern and was unsure what Enviromental health meant. I was happy to walk out,promised a refund but 3 weeks later..still waiting . Please go and see this for yourselves armed with camcorder and air freshener preferably wearing wellies.

Reviews.Title: “how can a hotel like this be left open....?? where are h and s people>>”
Reviews.Author: tomhannon
Reviews.Content: stay away.....sleep on a bench please.....do not go near this building......i know we are in recession but this is simply too much to bear..................no no no............

Reviews.Title: “Not at all good.”
Reviews.Author: Doctor_Pressure
Reviews.Content: We only stayed here because the Park's sister hotel, the Corbigoe (just as bad) did not have our rooms ready. The room in which I found myself was reached by going outside to a little alcove below the street level. It was very dirty, musty and mouldy. It had a little basin with hardly enough space around to wash. To take a shower I had to go outside again to access a tiny cubicle. The toilet was back inside the main hotel, up two flights of stairs. Breakfast was as plain as could be; only cereal, bread and toast were on offer. Granted, it is in a good location, but that is the only good thing. You probably would not want to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I have stayed in all my life”
Reviews.Author: BusinessTrip_11
Reviews.Content: When I turned up at the reception, I was told to pay an extra Â£3 for using a debit card. The hotel manager said that this was in their website, which I could not see when I visited their website. Secondly, I booked through an agent where the accomodation included breakfast. When I spoke to the hotel manager, he said that I had to pay an extra Â£3 for this. I was given a room, which was on the fourth floor, had to take my luggage all the way without being given any assistance from the hotel staff. When I entered the room, there was barely any place to walk - well I guess iI got what I had paid for. The toilet and bath cubicle were clean and there was hot shower. However, the TV was not working. The bed was I think two sofa's joined together and extremely uncomfortable to sleep in. In addition, I saw quite a big stain on the pillow and on the bedsheets quite a few bedbugs crawling on top of it!!!! Urghhhh!! I complained to the manager who plainly ignored. The room was extremely cold and the windows were not even double glazed. In addition, throughout the night, you could hear the buses going and coming and to add to this the next door neighbours kept on making a lot of noise. I could only get half an hours sleep. After this nighmarish experience, I WOULD STRONGLY URGE ANYONE NOT TO BOOK THIS HOTEL. There are plenty of hotels in London Victoria which I would have thought are much hygienic to this hotel with friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible customer service,dirty hotel!”
Reviews.Author: beauty15
Reviews.Content: It was terrible experience, the Indian Receptionist was very rude and unfriendly. Room was very small,dirty and cold. Never ever I would recommend this hotel to anybody. The information and pictures about the hotel are absolutely wrong. Don`t stay there...

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Disgusting, shouldnt be allowed to stay open!!!!”
Reviews.Author: claire_roach3
Reviews.Content: I am appauled with the service i recieved when i went to check in at the park hotel. When i arrived with my printed email of confirmation of my stay the man behind the counter was adament that there was no booking or reservation for me. He was extremley rude and called me a liar saying that i hadnt booked a room( even tho i had a copy of my confirmation with me). He then showed me to a room in the basement of the hotel that was disgusting, It was awful, it smelt, had no windows and not even a bathroom. I refused to stay in that room as it was that bad, therefore i had to cut my trip short as i couldnt find anywhere to stay. I WOULD NOT recommend this hotel to anyone it is a disgrace.

Reviews.Title: “A total disappointment and stressful nights stay”
Reviews.Author: katylou82
Reviews.Content: The man at reception lied claiming he couldn't help us with any problems as he was new, when in fact he had been there 7 years Had to walk 7 flights of stairs to our room could barely move in our double en-suite room The TV didn't work and they claimed to have no batteries to fix the remote and didn't want to fix the actual TV We had no hot water for a few hours then when we did we had to turn the shower on 15 mintues before we wanted to use it The toilet wouldn't flush The window was broken The carpet was filthy There was a lot of noise and disturbance all night The site claims breakfast is included but on arrival we were told we had to pay Feel like we were lied to and treated badly because we were young and the hotel ruined my weekend away, the man claimed that as we had a relatively cheap room we should expect a broken toilet, shower, window and non working TV. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY GOING THERE TO BE LET DOWN, and GOOD LUCK if you do!!

Reviews.Title: “This could have been so fantastico - Malathion needed 1 day after”
Reviews.Author: JH72
Reviews.Content: Got to the hotel with my wife, she didn't like the look of it straight away but as she was only dropping me off it was my decision to stay. Room 7 (you get a key - yale key for room 207) was where I stayed. It is on the 2nd floor, the room looks clean enough. There are doors to the balcony where there are endless cigarette butt ends on the flat roof. To windows to the balcony flat roof do NOT lock - security risk. This hotel could be so nice but when I checked in the old chap said here is your key, I asked if it was a good room he said "No its a normal room" he continued...if you want a five start hotel with pool go somewhere else....bad attitude from the start...I paid by Debit Card - yes Debit card and was charged Â£3...he told me it was advertised on the website...I never did check. The room has a shower very small sink and toilet...if you are a big person (like me) you won't like this room....I am going to cut this short...the hotel was worth the Â£27 I paid but no more. Tonight I got an emergency appointment with the doctor due to an all over rash....scabies...I have been given Derbac M Malathion Liquid as I itch all over. The bed seemed clean but then again there were hairs on the sheets...so they cannot have been changed. I was not offered breakfast, but to tell you the truth I would not have accepted it. Good location, shame about certain aspects, unhelpful staff. An unclean Fawlty Towers that could be so nice with some upgrading and proper chambermaids and staff. It is family run and they don't know how to change the sheets. I should have listened to the two girls when I was checking in....they were walking up the stairs and turned to me and said "Turn Back"...should I have? well if I did you wouldnt be getting this review and because I stayed I got to take some little critters with me for free! Ciao

Reviews.Title: “About this bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlbinasTaurage
Reviews.Content: We were spent 3 nights in Park Hotel in a triple room on the fourth floor. Number of room was 18. And we were very disappointed, because room was very small (about 6-7 square meters), window was not closing. It was cold in the room. A lot of things were not in the room - hairdryer, work desk, refrigerator, these things are only in note (http://www.easytobook.com/en/united-kingdom/greater-london/london/park-hotel/). But in the room was a lot of insect. When we come to reception to check in, hotel staff said that our card is not valid, and we could not to reserve room on line. It was unaccountable, because our booking status on line was Okand the card is no charged before stay, and we pay cash. Maybe it was a reason to give us so bad room? But we think about that we were be inform earlier .

Reviews.Title: “unimaginable”
Reviews.Author: granmaKiiminki
Reviews.Content: Arrived in the evening of 11 July woth 11-year old grandson. Was informed that for some conceited troubles with my Visa -card they could not accept us but we were directed to another hotel.In the August invoice of my Visa account there was a charge of more than 50â‚¬ made by The Park Hotel! We never stayed a single night there but had left immediately to the other hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away as faar as possible”
Reviews.Author: h_harshad
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel not customer friendly. Initial allocated room was good but made to shift that room for some stupid reason. Next room was horrible with broken windows and barely some space to move for 2 people. Ambiance and cleanliness was missing from everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “No windows and terrible customer service!”
Reviews.Author: PriyeshPatel
Reviews.Content: We didnt end up staying in this hotel thankfully as the agents had failed to inform them of our booking. We needed a triple room but were offered a "a double with a spare bed put in". The room we were shown was outside of the normal hotel building with a toilet/bathroom outside the room and up some stairs (you had to actually go outside!). The room itself was a terrible dingy room, with no windows at all and there was clearly no space for an extra bed to be put in there. Not only that, the service we had from the hotel was terrible. The hotel had been informed off our arrival date and triple room requirement but because no official booking was sent through the agent (HSD London), they had not allocated us a room. When we asked to speak to the agent, the receptionist and the agents had a heated conversation in their native tongue and i was not allowed to speak to the agents myself. Only after had i spent 15 minutes on the phone to the website where we had booked it through did we make any progress but they could still only offer us that double room with no windows so we left and found a better hotel across the road (The Victoria Inn). All in all, a truly horrible experience!

Reviews.Title: “the hotel receptionist is a cheater!”
Reviews.Author: kanthee
Reviews.Content: We ask the receptionist to do a favor for keeping our bags overnight. He said that each bag cost 2 pounds for one day/night but when we end up picking the bags he charged us 2 more pounds so the total is 4 pounds pay bag. Why? He came up with his stupid excuses that 2 pounds is just for half a day! That's a real cheater. So at the end we have to pay him with a little bargain for the price and the receptionists put all of our money in his own pocket without any receipt!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely disgusting”
Reviews.Author: Pagey54
Reviews.Content: My daughter was in London with work and originally booked in at the The Park hotel (owned by the same people who own The Corbigoe and just as badly rated). However when given the room at the Park in a basement was disgusted at what she saw. So agreed to the offer of a move to the Corbigoe. The Corbigoe was just as bad and in line with other reports for both hotels. Had to stop one night so slept on top of the bed fully clothed. Was sickened to find bugs crawling around on the bed in the morning. Apreciate both hotels may be a budget hotel but no excuse for this and should be closed down by the authorities and trading standards. Common theme related to these 2 and reflects on the owners. Be warned.

Reviews.Title: “Never again even if I am paid to stay”
Reviews.Author: Pickles01
Reviews.Content: The worst hotel ever I would even say disgraceful. The room was dirty, smelly, the window looking onto a wall, tv one channel with very bad reception, very noisy. BUGS in the bed. I cannot understand why agencies have this hotel on their lists. Being british, I am ashamed to know that such hotels exist for tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Awful.”
Reviews.Author: UKHec
Reviews.Content: Tired hotel with little to redeem it. Musty towels and poor breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “very rude and pushy”
Reviews.Author: emmajanerichardson12
Reviews.Content: when a arrived the we got pushed to book to have brakefast in the morning it was meant to be Â£6 but cause we didn't really want it he put it to Â£5 and pushed us into having it. All wot we got was toast which was tesco vaule bread and cerals which u couldn't eat because there was gone off milk. there was old bed mattresses blocking door the place was a mess and half the lights didn't work. the staff were very rude and we got ripped off big time. couldn't get any sleep there were banging doors all night.

Reviews.Title: “cheap n cheerful”
Reviews.Author: maz_clarke
Reviews.Content: small comfy rooms ...clean and quiet. helpful staff if a little obsessed with when you will check out !! overall cheap and cheerful

Reviews.Title: “Bloodstained bed!!!”
Reviews.Author: Dancestorm
Reviews.Content: Firstly the hotel man on reception was VERY rude upon arrival. When i went up to my room, the floor/carpet was sticky. The bed consisted of a SHEET yes, a SHEET not a quilt, a SHEET, it was freezing. But this wasnt any sheet... i inspected it to find it was stained with...BLOOD. IT was splattered with blood. I was itching so badly whilst sat on that bed and decided i couldnt stay there for 3 days. So i asked for my money back, and thought they would give it me back seems as id not stayed in the room, just popped my suitcase and inspected it. But no. The hotel man was very rude and said he would not give me a refund. I said iv payed for a poor service AND I WANT MY MONEY BACK IM NOT STAYING HERE SLEEPING IN BLOOD SPLATTERED SHEETS WITH BED BUGS!!! He said no i cant have my money back. When i asked to speak to the manager - suprise suprise its the managers day off.. how convenient. So i told him he'd better call him and tell him i want a refund. The man on reception said he didnt know how to work the card machine (yet he knew how to work it when i used it to pay before i saw the room...) anyway - the manager told him to give me back a measly Â£30. I told the reception man about the bed bugs - he said SHOW ME THE BEDBUGS SHOW THEM TO ME THERE IS NO BEDBUGS YOU LIE, YOU JUMP ON THE BANDWAGON LIKE EVERYONE ELSE DO Anyhow i went further on and found a hotel a tiny TINY bit cleaner still though with just a sheet for a bed, absolutely freezing and im going to have to sleep in my clothes tonight as it really is that cold. I will never trust a hotel in London again. DISCUSTING. The park hotel is the worst i have ever stayed in. Not even fit for a dog to live in.

Reviews.Title: “Run by criminals who rip everybody they can off,discracefull!”
Reviews.Author: sjonnief
Reviews.Content: I booked this '"hotel" 4 months in advance and received an email from them the day before i was due to arrive that my credit had been declined and my booking thus cancelled.This is a thing they do often i have since found out because they are then full and can rent your room out for more than you had agreed to pay when booking early.When i phoned them to inquire what had happened they just told me they had no explanation and it was my problem.When i said you'll give your "hotel" a bad name they just laughed and said we already have a bad name and we are not bothered about it or what people [guests] say.Still,having since read reports over this craphouse it was probably a blessing in disguise

Reviews.Title: “Only good thing is the location”
Reviews.Author: greekguy29
Reviews.Content: We arrived to this hotel with my fiance in late November. The only thing good about this hotel is the location which is near Victoria station and has good connection with airports and you can walk to some main attractions. The room was absolutely terrible, the sink in the bathroom was ready to fall, its a pity I didn't take any photos but I didn't want to spoil my mood with that. Floor was very dirty, sheets on the bed seemed that they hadn't been changed for some time (they had stains on them).The stuff was polite but they should spend some money on the hotel itself. If you want to stay near the center without spending much money, I wouldn't recommend this hotel. Its better to stay at one of the suburbs with a good connection with the tube.

Reviews.Title: “Cradle of Filth!”
Reviews.Author: Kimo_sabii
Reviews.Content: The worst , worst , worst hotel in the world , they have not heard of the word 'cleanliness' ...just a filthy depressing place to stay

Reviews.Title: “UUUGGGHHH!!!”
Reviews.Author: MrMouser
Reviews.Content: I saw this on the list and went to my pictures to see if it was the same place I stayed at the first time I went to London. Yep I remember it well. I thought there weren't any maids so I put a little L on my sheet in pencil and it was there the whole 4 discusting days we stayed. We didn't take our shoes off on the floor and wore flip flops in the shower as well. I have the same bad pictures as everyone else of this hotel. Not only was is gross but, the man at the desk was just plain rude to me because I asked which coins to use in the soda machine. He was also just plain rude to us the whole stay but, only yessed at me that one time I asked which coins to use. I remember having to carry all our luggage up to the third floor I think and I didn't pack light for my first trip overseas. It was definately not a good first impression of the uk. Take a biohazard suit with you for this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Sometimes a bargain is NOT a bargain...”
Reviews.Author: wildgeneral
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed at the Park Hotel for 2 nights earlier this week. First, there is no elevator/lift, so you will be forced to carry your luggage up numerous flights of stairs (5 flights for us). Next is the room. Upon walking into the room, an overwhelming smell hits you...I can't describe it, but suffice to say that it was not pleasant. The bathroom is, LITERALLY, a closet that was converted to a bathroom. It was probably about 5 feet by 4 feet. ...oh, the bathroom smelled worse than the room, itself, if that is possible! The room was hot and there was no way to adjust the temperature. This turned out to be a minor problem since it was January and we were able to open a window...but in Summer, opening the window would not help. Now...the kicker: BED BUGS. I'm not exaggerating either. I woke up in the middle of the night, itching all over... I turned on the light and found that I had welts all over my body, except for where I was clothed. It was horrendous! I completely agree with another poster here, who stated that any hotel site that lists this hotel as an option should reevaluate their criteria for listings.

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL I HAVE EVER STAYED I MEAN EVEEEER!!!”
Reviews.Author: chriseiser
Reviews.Content: this hotel is the worst of all! i stayed there with my girlfriend in september, and we woke up in the middle of the night on our first night after a long day of travel from mexico, with bed bugssssss horrible, i payed 2 nights and no cash at all was refund! they told us they didnt had the money in the hotel beacuase the manager has it! so i never got anything. and still the employee told "you cant come here and wake me up in the middle of the night to get a refund" come at 10 where manager is back, at 10 manager wasnt there! jaja joke of place . rooms are small , bathroom is awful , and the beds are so dirty! it seems they have been there for 30 years or more! i went to a hotel next door of this crab, ant they told me that park hotel has been the worst hotel in 3 consecutive years, on belgrave road, i checked out inmmediatly and went to the best western , where service rooms quality was very good ! after that i prefer to pay more than staying in that horrible hotel! please trust me dont go there it stinks!!

Reviews.Title: “Room covered in mold. Bring own ammonia to stay in good location.”
Reviews.Author: Utrecht09
Reviews.Content: Do not stay here until they've rectified basic health code/honest service violations. When we arrived, the clerk showed us the room and suggested that we would want to find another place to stay. He showed us the mold and the non-working faucet. We were not offered a discount. We were offered the chance to pay for one night and move on. The sheets appeared to be clean. The rest of the place was not. The white shower curtain, easy to change, was covered in black mold. The bed cover and curtain in the room were covered with clear/whitish crusty stuff. The location is good, but paying more than 6 Euros/Pounds a night to stay here is too much if you are in the country legally and not trying to hide. I am not a neat-freak, and am a very cheap person, and this was still unacceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Lowest quality hotel I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: p80Uk
Reviews.Content: Very tired decor. No hot water. Cold water leaked onto bathroom floor. Bare wires in LIVE light fitting! Loose stair carpet. Fire escape door used to store vacuum cleaner. Hope they are well insured as it is a disaster waiting to happen!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutly discusting”
Reviews.Author: Rbar74
Reviews.Content: This is not a hotel, it is a hostel, and a terrible one at that. The first room we were given had no running water, no shower, and was roughly the size of a stock room. The door hit the bed on the way in. The place is falling apart. Breakfast consisted of coffe and toast, that was all that was available, continental it is not! This place has no formal stars awarded, bone at all, and I'm not suprised, it is listed as a two star on this site, but I have checked with the tourist board, and it is not listed. When we complained, it was suggested we take a shower in another room in the morning. We didn't accept that, and were reluctantly moved to another room. This one had matter dripping out if an extractor fan onto the toilet, which itself was contained within what can only be described as some sort of tiny plastic diving chamber that comprises the shower, toilet and sink. Vile. Vile. Vile. This should be delisted from any self respecting hotel site.

Reviews.Title: “DISGUSTING!!!”
Reviews.Author: honest_kiwi
Reviews.Content: The standard of this hotel was completely unacceptable. I had no choice but to leave after the first night. The issues I encountered were as follows: CLEANING The hotel was generally unclean, and the room I was given (# 7) in particular was filthy: 1) The balcony outside the room was littered with cigarette butts and other rubbish 2) The carpet in the room was soiled, shabby and had not been vacuumed 3) The draws of the bedside were covered in stains 4) The bed linen was torn and stained 5) The room had a stench of dampness 6) Due to concerns regarding cleanliness of the room, I felt uncomfortable about the hygiene risks of using the bed. Instead I kept my clothes on, covered the bedding with spare clothes and slept rather uncomfortably in that state. 7) The floor, hand basin, toilet and shower unit in the bathroom so dirty I was not able to make use of the bathroom at all. MAINTENANCE The overall standard of maintenance of the hotel and my room (# 7) was very poor: 1) There were large holes punched in the walls that had not been repaired 2) The plumbing made an extremely loud noise for at least 2 minutes after I or occupants of other rooms flushed the toilet 3) The wardrobe unit was flimsy, unstable and had folded up maps jammed underneath it to prevent it from falling over INTERNET WiFi internet service was offered at 3 pounds per day. This worked well on the first evening of my stay, however on the following morning it was impossible to access the internet, and shortly after the WiFi router was switched off altogether by the person on duty at reception. Note that there are other free WiFi internet services with good signal strength that can be accessed from the room I was staying in. It was from there I made a booking for another hotel which is less expensive and much nicer. BATHROOM In addition to being unclean, the bathroom was dilapidated and extremely small. Sitting on the toilet in an upright position was impossible as the hand basin was located in such a position to prevent this. The shower unit was big enough for a small child at best, not that I would not subject a child (or anyone else) to using the bathroom in the first instance. RUDE SERVICE I encountered several problems with the person on duty at reception: 1) He accused me of over-using the WiFi service and causing it to fail (anyone with any technical knowledge of internet technology would know this is a ridiculous accusation) 2) He demanded that I "SPEAK LOUDER" when discussing the issue of payment for the WiFi service. Note that I had concerns about the reliability of the internet service when I checked in due to the shabby state of the hotel reception area, and was provided the access password in advance to ensure the system would work. The "SPEAK LOUDER" incident occurred after the WiFi service had stopped working. 3) When I enquired as to how long it would be before the internet service would be restored I was given the response "I don't know". I asked whether it might be an hour, the morning, the day... still the answer was "I don't know". 4) When checking out I attempted to advise the manager of these issues. He spoke over me and never gave me the opportunity to explain my reasons for checking out early. BREAKFAST Breakfast was offered for 2 pounds. All that was available was corn flakes, rice bubbles, orange juice, coffee, bread and some spreads. It was poorest breakfast I have ever seen, let alone for a hotel. DEMAND FOR FURTHER PAYMENT / REFUND REFUSAL When I informed the manager that I was leaving, he demanded payment for the WiFi internet service (which had failed by this time) and the breakfast (which as stated above was completely unsatisfactory). The manager stated nonetheless that I should pay for these services. Furthermore, even though the manager was fully aware that no refund was available upon early checkout for the remaining two days booked, he stated that I should contact expedia.com to seek a refund. This was an obvious, outright and extremely insulting lie. Given the hotel had received payment for the following two nights of the booking, the WiFi service had failed, the breakfast was unacceptable and I had paid for two unused nights of accommodation I refused to pay for these services, and even then felt very much ripped off! SUMMARY In the country I come from (New Zealand) this hotel would be closed down on the basis of both poor hygiene and unfair trading practices. I hope no one else has the misfortune of booking this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: MichaelX032
Reviews.Content: I only needed one night at a hotel in London and I choose this because of its availability. The room was terrible, the bedsheets unclean as was the room itself. To top this the receptionist was extremely rude. It operates with a curfew where you need to be in at 1am at the latest. Even though this clearly is a budget hotel it is simply of a far too low standard. I cannot understand that it stays open. I will certainly never stay there again. You can easily find other hotels in the area at almost the same price.

Reviews.Title: “The worst place I had ever slept in”
Reviews.Author: Lucatd
Reviews.Content: I've been travelling for 25 yrs. I slept in camping, Youth hostels, apartments, hotels, in trains, in railway stations... But this is reallu the worst! The arrival: you have to pay in advance.... maybe because they ae sure that after a first look at the room you'll escape The room: dirty is not enough. Bottle caps and dust on the floor, blood stains on the wall, snack packs everywhere, no wardrobe and no place where to hang your clothes, a broken and dirty bedside table. I put a white shirt in the drawer without looking in it and there was a yellow liquid that made a large stain in it... had to find a laundry to have it clean for the evening after. The tv has no remote and you must be at least 175 cm tall to switch it on and change programs. Electricity facilities are dangerously made.... and the tv could fall on your bed You can see all the pictures in this picasa web album: http://picasaweb.google.com/lucatd/ParkHotelBelgraveRdLondon The bathroom: smaller than possible, with mould stains everywere, a constant sewer odour. Iy was impossible to wash your teeth wihout soaking your feet, because of the water dipping from the broken sink. The breakfast: entered the so called breakfast room. Not even tried to taste..... The 1am policy: you can't go back the hotel after 1 am... Nobody is there to keep it open... if you're late you'll sleep in the street....

Reviews.Title: “never visit this hotel”
Reviews.Author: tatmac
Reviews.Content: we booked this hotel because it said it was cheap but clean, we were going to see Take That at wembley so its only a room for the night eh! its no wonder they make you pay before you see the room otherwise i think i would have taken my chances on finding another hotel, but i guess thats what they play on, that everything else is much more expensive and full at weekends. the room was filthy, the toilet seat was hanging off, if you sat on it your knees hit the door and i had one foot in the shower, and i am only 5.8. the wardrobe door was falling off, there were no handles on the bedside drawer, tea and coffee had been wet and allowed to dry out, but this didn't really matter as there was no kettle. the curtains couldnt be pulled fully as they were hanging off. the road is incredibly noisy at night, i could go on but i am sure you get the picture. NEVER VISIT THIS HOTEL. steve and katy.

Reviews.Title: “what a dump”
Reviews.Author: steveWare
Reviews.Content: went down to london this weekend and deciced we would stay rather than come home late at night and booked into park hotel.we were lucky the room we were allocated sleeps five and as there was only two of us we thought we would have plenty of space.when entering the room there was four beds all pushed together and all of them were disgusting.this room sleeps five but not us two forget the money we travelled home it was easier to cut our losses rather than to lose time off work due to the various deseases we would have caught had we stayed there.BE WARNED THIS PLACE IS A TOTAL NO STAR FLEAPIT OF THE HIGHEST ORDER.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: ingvas
Reviews.Content: The bathroom was so small, that we had our knees in the door. The doorknob fall out when I touched it. It leaked water from the tap. We had to beg for towels every second day. The Hotel was not cleaned up. A smokedetector wouldnt work properly, and made sounds outside our door for two days. The manager got angry when I asked him to put an end to this noise.

Reviews.Title: “A lucky escape”
Reviews.Author: abc6
Reviews.Content: After making a late online booking into the Corbigoe which is apparently the Park's sister hotel I was greeted by the most depressed looking receptionist on arrival. He informed me that the Corbigoe was fully booked and that a room was available at the Park Hotel. I was escorted into the basement of the Park by a staff member and offered the opportunity to look at the room before I payed. I could not believe the room that they were suggesting that I stay in. The room was virtually the size of the double bed with a tiny sink in the corner. It was damp and stunk to high heaven. I would have not let my dog sleep in there for the night. I fled with my life and headed to the nearby Best Western. The park hotel is a total joke and dont say that you have not been warned. Tired looking decor and staff alike. AVOID AT ALL COST even at Â£45 a night! Would I recommend a friend would i *ollocks!

Reviews.Title: “the worst hotel ever seen”
Reviews.Author: misspoppy63
Reviews.Content: It was a nightmare. Very small room (just me and a single bed), too dirty, no hot water, no heating, no service. And they wanted me to pay twice for it. Keep away from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare! Disgusting room, disgusting service! :-( would Not reccommend!”
Reviews.Author: LoopyLaura447
Reviews.Content: My friend had booked a brilliant trip to London as a present for my 21st Birthday, and we planned to stay at Park Hotel! When we got to the hotel, the man at reception seemed pretty depressed - not the best way to greet new guests! We were given our room and when we got into it we could not believe our eyes....the room was tiny, smelled and didnt appear very clean at all! On a closer inspection the bed looked like it hadnt been changed in weeks, the toilet was absolutely tiny - It actually looked like a portaloo had been stuck onto the side of the room, but also managed to fit a shower and a sink, so it was impossible to move in it. The light in the toilet was hanging off, which is pretty dangerous considering its surrounded by water. The mould and grime on the window/door was revolting (please look at my pictures), and when the bedside drawer was opened we were faced with a half eaten jar of jam, tub of nutella and lots of crumbs! This proved that the room hadnt been cleaned properly for our arrival! :-( The room also had no lock on the door from the inside, so you wouldnt have felt safe during the night. We left our luggage in the hotel, and went to enjoy the start of our holiday. The hotel makes you leave your key at the reception which on looking back was a bad sign. After we left we decided that we couldnt stay there, so we phoned the hotel and they agreed to change our room when we got back from our day out. When we arrived back at the hotel, the receptionist, still as happy as ever, told us that he had moved all our luggage to a different room, in a DIFFERENT HOTEL without informing us. We tried to kick up a fuss about it as they had done this without telling us anything, when they did have a contact number to do so, but the man was extremely rude and didnt see what was so wrong with what he had done. I asked to look in the room which we were in, to ensure that no personal belongings had been missed, but he wouldnt let us, and said the room was being used by other guests already, which i highly doubt because nobody could stay there. He then told us to follow him to the other hotel, and whilst following him, he never said a word to us, not a single sorry passed his lips. On arriving at the other hotel, and after being shown our room - which was no better, i asked the man for his name incase anything turned out to be missing. He told us that we had to check our luggage infront of him to ensure that nothing was missing, and that as soon as he left he was not being held responsible for anything. I kept asking him for his name, which he refused to give us, and would only give us his managers name and the hotels phone number. He then walked out and left us to it. Still no apology! :-( We decided that we couldnt stay in the new hotel either as it was just as unclean. This one was called the Corbigoe Hotel. So we decided to find another hotel and stay there. I would no way recommend any of these hotels. For a cheap and cheerful hotel i would recommend the hotel we eventually found which was easyhotels.com - an easyjet hotel on Belgrave Road too. Please look at my attached pictures.

Reviews.Title: “I really dont know how this place stays open”
Reviews.Author: BobSmithyorks
Reviews.Content: Where do I start.... The hotel says 3 minute walk from Victoria yet it took me 20 minutes the other day (and I walk fast). I had a room on the ground floor that looked nothing like the one on the picture.... The carpet was in two pieces and a repair had been attempted. It was unclean and the kettle was yellow. The bathroom was like a world of its own.... There was deep soil deposits in the toilet from the lack of cleaning and half the walll had fallen off under the sink because of damp. The shower looked like it hadnt been cleaned ever...... Seriously, I am considering ringing the environmental health as people should not be allowed to stay in rooms like this even despite the cost. If you value your health you will not book here... I have photos and will upload shortly

Reviews.Title: “Give this one a wide berth!!!”
Reviews.Author: Taz071980
Reviews.Content: Lord only knows how this place even got a 1 star. Yes it's cheap and yes you certainly get what you pay for. We got lost finding it and rang up to get directions but the chap on reception had poor english and couldn't help. When we checked in we were given a key and form to fill but no mention of breakfast. We opted to use the local MacD's instead. We were told to go to our room not shown and the place felt slanted as you walk. As for the room. It was described as plain walls. Yes plain walls with dirt, damp and other marks. The bathroom was like a shower cubicle and toilet in one and the furniture needed repairing. If I had a screwdriver I would have done it myself!! We were disturbed on the first night by our room neighbours making a racket as the walls were thin and also the bed felt like you were on a ship, you rolled together!! We spent our main day away from the hotel and had a great time in london. The only things this place boasts is location to things tube/train/Big Ben etc and cost BUT, if you're looking for anything other than a doss down (worse than a hostel) don't pick here. I camp quite often and had the weather been better would have preferred to do that!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel in London”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveller200927
Reviews.Content: Worst hotel we have ever stayed at. The concierge (whose name I believe is Con) is the rudest person we have come across. Please avoid this hotel at all cost.

Reviews.Title: “Eva Nikolova, Bulgaria- oufull 3 nights in Park hotel”
Reviews.Author: e11Bulgaria
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel with my friends and was so happy that we'll see London!!! When we arrived- 2 pm, the rooms were not ready!!! Give us one room down /down first floor/ an one on the first floor. Was terrible - without daylight, cold and small rooms, very very dirty . We asked to change our rooms, but.... The room for the breakfast was too very small - for 5 persons. All day we go around London and then go to the pubs for dinner and beer because we must be drunk to go again in this hotel in our rooms. And for the end- I payed with my credit card but the hotel blocked deposit one night. When i arrived asked on the reception and told me that everything will be ok . I come back to Bulgaria , pass one month but my money are still blocked from park hotel. I sending two e mails to the hotel and nothing!!!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid Like The Plague”
Reviews.Author: KiethNeil
Reviews.Content: I'd rather lick my big toes than stay in this hotel again. It's as simple as that. Where do I start with listing the problems of this hotel? Ok, I'll go from the start. We arrived at the hotel around 1pm, and squeezed up to the reception hole in the wall. After telling the receptionist of our booking he told us the credit card we had used didn't work so we had to be moved down the road to a different hotel. We followed the man to the reception of another hotel where he told us we would be staying. The man at the new hotel said he didn't want us, so like a heard of cattle we were ushered back to the original 'Park Hotel'. Once there he told us he had a room for us, however there wasn't enough beds in the room, so he would arrange for a mattress to be put on the floor for a 10 pound discount. Reluctantly, and with no other option, we accepted and made out way to the room. We then couldn't get into the room because it was still being 'cleaned'. The guy who was cleaning was taking so long messing around I offered to hoover up for him, just to get rid of him and so we could get into our room. It was hardly cleaned as it was, cans outside the window from previous guests, a manky shower/toilet room, no towels and no toilet paper. The view from the window was spectacular, a breeze block and a metal bar! The bathroom was a box in the corner, where the toilet was placed so you couldn't sit on it with the door closed. The shower curtain looked like it had previously been a piece of wallpaper, and the pipe to the shower head provided most of the water to the shower, not the shower head. London is a great place though, despite the attitude of some of the officers of the law. But stay well away from The Park Hotel in Victoria. The tenner discount was all well and good, but I wouldn't stay in this hotel again for free!

Reviews.Title: “Find another hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tomhec
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 5 days. No clean sheets, no clean (dry) towels, no hot water in the bath (sometimes no water at all), and there was mould in the bath because the ventilation was inoperative. Terrible smell from the bathroom. No cleaning of the room while we lived there. Old dirt on walls and doors in room. Breakfast in a room which was about 9 square meters, to guests from 19 rooms. We chose to eat breakfast in a park nearby.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel in London?”
Reviews.Author: wksGermany
Reviews.Content: The room was unbelievable. The "bath room" was even worse. My kids (10 and 12 years old) refused to use it. And there were no towels!! Breakfast was from 8.00 to 9.30. Not a very wide range. But if you arrive at the very narrow breakfast room at 9.10, coffee is out. And if you ask for new coffee this is denied with the words that the breakfast time ends at 9.30. This hotel cannot be recommended, absolutely not.

Reviews.Title: “cramped”
Reviews.Author: biancajill
Reviews.Content: Location-wise, this was a good place - not too far a walk (10 minutes) from Victoria Station. We stayed a night in a quad room which consisted of 2 double beds, a chest of drawers, and very little floor space to put our luggage. The fixtures and furniture appear old and needed replacing (broken drawers, browned kettle, precariously dangling clothes rack) The sheets were clean, though. Not much of a view outside our window, just a brick wall. The attached bathroom was the talk of the day. The shower/ toilet area was the smallest that we had ever seen - the whole bathroom was roughly the size of a shower pod. (Quote from a fellow traveller: a converted cupboard). Needless to say, it was a squeeze trying to shower and not bang one's elbows on the surrounding walls, or to use the toilet without banging against the unlockable door. It is high time for the piping system to be replaced as there were loud sounds whenever the taps are open and funny smells ensued from the water outlet. Breakfast was simple but sufficient - unlimited amounts of orange juice, coffee, tea, toast, cereals. The dining area, like the room, was very small -- it was a wonder how that many chairs were squeezed in that small area. For the location and the price you pay, this hotel is good for sleeping after a long day of sightseeing. But lots of luck in using the bathroom!

Reviews.Title: “Mould, glorious mould!!”
Reviews.Author: nyrdan
Reviews.Content: WHAT THE? We were placed on the top floor in a room that appears to have been bigger than most. The toilet/shower was absolutely disgraceful - full of mould and a filthy stench coming from the drain. The actual shower wasnt big enough to bathe a baby in. The weather was atrocious - which I only mention because it was reflected in our room. The bed and all of the blankets/sheets were soaking wet because the roof was leaking all over it. We ended up having to move the bed (which was actually a mattress sitting on wooden boxes) into another position in the room because of the rain. Renovations were being completed in the room next door to us, although these only ever occurred from 11.00 pm until the early hours of the morning. The builders were obviously nocturnal. We stayed here for 4 nights and at the end of it, we were both really sick. We went to check out to find the doorman asleep in a sleeping bag on the floor of reception. We gratetfully threw the keys in his general direction and walked out. I think I would have much rather stayed on a bench in the local park, which I will probably be doing should we again find ourselves in the same position. After having stayed at a large number of hostels, this hotel is only good for knocking down. Do yourself a favour and don't even consider it.

Reviews.Title: “Typhoid Cubicle”
Reviews.Author: ziggykue
Reviews.Content: Given room 9 which was dirty, but clean sheets on the bed. shower/toilet cubicle (which you couldn't turn round in)stank of sewage from the shower plug-hole- no way could you have a shower in there. also the toilet seat was split in two, which was is not very hygienic. Asked reception to be moved-but the manager wasn't in until the morning,so had to sleep in the room with the toilet door closed due to the terrible smell. In the morning asked the manager to move us,He said theyre was no other rooms available. I wasn't giving in so he said come back after 10.O'clock & he would give us another room,he did which was better than the first,although when the hot tap was turned on it flooded the floor & we had to put a towel down to soak it up, no remote for the T.V you had to stand on the bed to turn it on etc, & the radiator didn't work, all in all it needed a good spring clean!

Reviews.Title: “Bad Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Holla118118
Reviews.Content: My Sister And I Just Got Back From A 1 Night Stay At The Park Hotel, 1 Night Was All We Needed, It Was Awfull, We Arrived Around 2pm In the Afternoon, the phrase "dont judge a book by is cover" is SO true in this case. he road and outside of he hotel looks amazing very high class but inside it looked like a council flat. we waited around 30 mins at reseption because no one was there, another person infornt of us has been waiting even longer, When somone finally arrived he spoke very bad enlish and was very hard to understand. We Finally got our room key and paid by cash but was shocked to discover if you pay via cash you have to pay a Â£2 service charge, what service? We Droped Out Bags off and headed into london, we were seeing a concert so we were not planning on spending any real time in the hotel, just to sleep really. We arrived back at he hotem around midnight, As before there was no one in reception, after around 20 mins i noticed a man outside smoking i asked if he worked there and he said "yeah, why" i said well we want the keys to our room, he was very rude and seemed annoyed he had to stop smoking and do what he is paid to do. The Room we were in #9 was like a prison, it was small, smelly and very unclean, We booked a room with 2 double beds, we only got 1 double and 1 single, here was only 2 of us and it costed us Â£60 for 1 night. The beds in the room were hard and smelly, it was the worst nights sleep i have ever had. he bathroom made me sick, it was more like a cupboard, the toilet was brown with durt, the shower had no holder so you had to hold it to take a shower, he floor was uneven and when you ook a shower the whole tfloor was in a centermeter of water. The breakfast was no even worth looking at, the cerial was in wha can only be described as a drinks despencer, god knows how long it had been there, All in all it was the WORST hotel i have ever stayed in, i was noisy, smelly and unclean, how i can call itself a hotel is beyond me.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER STAY at PARK HOTEL!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lovetravellingJapan
Reviews.Content: It was the WORST hotel I've ever stayed!!! I booked for 3 nights, but it was SOOOOO terrible that i ran away from the hotel after the first night. I asked them to pay me back for the other 2 nights, but of course they said NO! My room was on the 4th floor and i had a heavy suitcase so i asked for their help, but they said NO! They were very very rude in many ways!! The room was extremely filthy!!! The coffee cup wasn't cleaned!!! Tiny room, noise from other rooms and the street and tiniest bathroom I've ever seen...! I'm a small Japanese girl, but it was so hard to take shower in the tiny bathroom and of course the entire bathroom got soaked!! I knew I wasn't going to get the money back, but I didn't wanna ruin my wonderful vacation in London, so I went to look for another hotel on the first night. I wasted 80 pounds(for 2 nights), but I'm glad I changed the hotels!! If you wanna have a great experience in London, pay a little more to stay somewhere else! I paid 50 pounds(only 10 pounds more than Park hotel), and I got a really nice hotel. I hope my review will help somebody who wants to enjoy their trip!!

Reviews.Title: “OK for the price, but be prepared!”
Reviews.Author: Matilda82
Reviews.Content: I didn't look at Trip Advisor before I went on this short break (which is unusual for me!), and I'm glad I didn't! I feel, based on my experience, that these reviews are a little harsh, unless we were just lucky! My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel for four nights in January 2008, and seeing as the whole stay only cost Â£140 (Â£17.50 pppn) I was expecting the pits! But we decided to book anyway due to the great location, and the notion that we'd hardly be spending any time there! Throughout our stay, day and night, the men on reception were polite enough. Yes the stairs are narrow, the room was very small and the bathroom was a tiny prefabricated â€œWet-Roomâ€� unit, not unlike those found in caravans; but everything worked, we always had hot water and most of all it was clean. Some people stay away in caravans for weeks on end and donâ€™t complain that their toilet set gets wet when they have a shower! The breakfast was basic, but there was plenty of it: Orange Juice, Cereals, Toast & Jam, and Tea & Coffee. But beware it finishes bang on time, and if you miss it itâ€™s tough luck Iâ€™m afraid! We generally left the hotel around eight or nine in the morning and got back around midnight each night, so as expected we werenâ€™t there long! Iâ€™m glad we stayed there but unfortunately we didnâ€™t get any pictures to share with you. As the title for this review states be prepared for the worst and complain if anythingâ€™s wrong! (Although I canâ€™t comment on whether it wouldâ€™ve been effective to complain, because we didnâ€™t have to.) If you have booked it already, donâ€™t let these reviews put you off, just look forward to whatever it is youâ€™re going to London for!!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: Generalpuffball
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked for me through work. It was absolutely terrible. The room was so small I could hardly turn round in it. I had already asked to move to another room as the previous one reeked of drains. The bathroom fittings were dirty and chipped or broken completely. The TV was broken.
