The carpet had not been vacuumed and it was badly stained. I had to eat in the hotel restaurant as those in the local area were all full. The waitresses were having a full-on row, shouting at each other from opposite sides of the room. Their language was appalling and then they kept trying to involve me in their argument! I ordered a pizza and waited 40 minutes for a frozen one to appear. It was cold and still frozen in the middle. I sent it back and after waiting 20 minutes with no sign of food or a waitress I walked out. I mentioned these problems to the reception staff who simply shrugged. I asked to speak to a manager and was told the manager was not available until the morning. A dreadful hotel experience. Don't go there!

Reviews.Title: “An expensive dirty cramped cupboard in London costing the earth”
Reviews.Author: beth1936
Reviews.Content: We got transferred to this hotel after making a booking at the 101 Belgrave Road London which apparently had some electrical problems so was unable to accommodate us and this was an associate Hotel. The room was very small the fixtures were of very a poor quality the chest of drawers were all broken,mugs were chipped wash hand basin was cracked with no stopper and T/V did not work, This is the worst experience I have ever had staying at a Bed & Breakfast anywhere. High volume of conversation in reception area going on untill the early hours of the morning resulting in very little sleep allthough the bed was comfortable. In all this was very expensive at Â£65.00 for a single nights stay

Reviews.Title: “Never EVER again there”
Reviews.Author: ThyPy
Reviews.Content: Travelled with my family to stay a weekend in London, booked through Central IR. Nice street (Belgrave rd), polite staff. Entering my room started the terrible experience, it looked like never been cleaned for ages! ear-swab, a lost male stocking, trash paper and dust under the beds, bathroom with dark lime layer over the bath floor.... 3 extra pounds to pay with credit card.

Reviews.Title: “Wont be staying here again”
Reviews.Author: Suddabmp01
Reviews.Content: We arrived, and had to wait until a receptionist returned about 10 minutes later. We weren't expecting The Ritz, but we didn't expect what we got. The room was small with a double bed, a tv, and 2 mirrors. That was all that was in there as well as the bathroom. There was no wardrobe, drawers, bedside table, or anything like that. The bathroom was so small, you could shower, use the toilet, shave, and brush your teeth all at once, no that we did. The first thing we noticed were the stains on the bed cover. The sheets underneath were clean, but the top cover was disgusting. The ceiling was just plaster board, there were cracks in the walls and stains on them too. The location was brilliant, and if you are just staying for one night, its is not too bad once you get over the initial reaction of disgust. The towels were clean, and its about a 10 minute walk to the tube station at Pimlico. However, i would not recommend the hotel to any friends

Reviews.Title: “room 9”
Reviews.Author: SomersetYuffi
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews for this hotel it was with some trepidation myself & my daughter approached it, apparently a double room was booked for us by last minute.com but after i explained we wanted a twin they gave us room 9, 1 single bed & a 4footer, clean sheets cleanish room although abit shabby, toilet i must admit needs bleach down it, a halfway decent tv, water ok 4 shower, so ask for room 9 if you want abit more space, but if you don't want to risk it book elsewhere, dunno about breakfast as unfortunetly we didn't make it in time! so for the reasonable price of 1 night it was ok!

Reviews.Title: “Urgh”
Reviews.Author: KF1980
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely gross. My room absolutely stank of mould and damp, there was a thick layer of dust on the carpet behind the door, and the toilet had definitely not been cleaned in weeks. The en-suite bathroom was like a portaloo (and it smelled like it) that had been dumped in the worlds smallest bedroom. It was five stories with no lift. The TV reception was abysmal, I couldn't bear to have it on it was so crackly. The mattress was so worn there was a spring poking through. I came in one day to find a man using the shared toilet with the door wide open. This is not a place for anyone with an ounce of decency to stay, please please please stay somewhere else. Go for a hotel with a name you recognise in this area - Days Inn or Holiday Inn, at least you know what to expect there.

Reviews.Title: “disgusting!”
Reviews.Author: fireeyes
Reviews.Content: This was a disgusting hotel. I wouldn't recommend this to a bum. The floors were nasty with hair all over it. Mold in the bathroom, bugs on the floor. They only give you towel and sometimes we had to ask for that and then they were the size of a dish cloth. There was an exposed socket we asked them to cover or fix and they didn't. We had to wait several times for hotel staff to show up to let us in our room - we waiting anywhere from 30-45 minutes. The shower was smaller than what you would find in a travel trailer. There is no elevator and my husband has a bad back - we asked for a first floor room and they said no. The small nightstand had bugs and someone elses hair in the drawers with their receipts. There were baby carriages in the hallway so you couldn't even get through unless you moved them out of the hallway. This is not a one star rating which is supposed to be comparable to Super 8 ect. NOT EVEN CLOSE!!

Reviews.Title: “I will never be the same again...”
Reviews.Author: Glenn_Katie
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Park Hotel in December of 2005. Even after this time I still can't get over how bad it was. My wife and I stayed with another couple who we were travelling with in the very bottom room of the place (it had two double beds). Our first impression was VERY LOW BUDGET, but we had accepted it would probably be cheap and nasty when we booked - and we had decided the location was worth the risk. I can still remember the room and its problems even now. I get a chill down my spine thinking of it. Here's a list of what was wrong: 1) My wife pulled back the bedsheets and found a used band-aid. So much for clean sheets! We slept in sleeping bags instead on top of the bed. The beds were also awful. I'm sure they must have been on Noah's Ark. 2) Our room was right below the entrance. Every time (lasting until 2am in the morning) when someone entered the hotel above us, we were all woken by the creaking floor above. 3) The shower/toilet/basin made it possible to simultaneously shower, do a #2 and clean your teeth at the same time. Not that we did, but it was the first (and only) such bathroom where this would be theroretically possible that we have seen. 4) On the subject of the bathroom - a furry mould grew in it, and water leaked out of it into the room at the rate that the Thames River discharges into the sea. 5) The TV was precariously placed on a wardrobe. I refused to sleep under it because I felt that either the TV would fall down, or the wardrobe would collapse - either case leading to a visit to the Royal London Hospital if it happened. I was frankly amazed that the TV was in colour given its age. 6) Some rude staff. One of the staff members would abuse his cleaning staff in front of guests for being 2 minutes late. Very unprofessional, and also uncomfortable. 7) Stairs down to our room were so narrow I had to go down sideways. I am not overweight. The width of the stairwell would have been approximately 40-50cm. So far... 7 points against. The only plus is the location. We did stick it out for our full 5 nights, though, as we didn't have the money to book a better place. I'm not quite sure what ill effects I suffer to this day after staying there - but I'm sure there must be something. No one could stay in a place like that and not pick up some disease/fungus. Oddly enough one staff number took a liking to us. He even referred to us "Ah my friends from number 1" (our room number was 1). I suspect that may have been because we set a record for the length stayed there, and he thought we might give the place a glowing review. He is sadly mistaken.

Reviews.Title: “iT was not so bad as the reviews.”
Reviews.Author: palgyal
Reviews.Content: It was not so bad as the reviews. i agree the room and bathroom was small. The bathroom was a bit too crampy. The room was was better than the private rooms in the hostels at the same rate.We came to London to have a good time and we did. Be pepared for the size of the rooms and the toilet. dont expect it to be spacious. please confirm the rooms before you set off. if you keep all of this in mind then you will have a good hassle free stay.

Reviews.Title: “The Park Hotel should be gutted”
Reviews.Author: lnjohnston
Reviews.Content: After having reservation troubles due to lastminutelondon.com, I had to get the booth at Victoria Station to book a room for me. My plane to the US was early the next day. This is the worst hotel I've ever stayed in--anywhere. They could not give me a receipt, I reminded them twice I wanted a 5 am wakeup call, the room and bath were filthy. The next morning, no wakeup call, no hot water. Luckily I always set an alarm as well. They were asleep when I wanted to check out, and when I woke the desk man, he was grumbling that he had slept through 2 more wakeup calls. It should be closed and gutted. Spending the night at Gatwick would have been preferable, but no trains after midnight. Worst 55 pounds ever spent. I wish I'd been pick-pocketed on the street instead. Your site lists it as far more money! NO NO a Thousand times NO. Stay at Gatwick if you can get there, at least it's cleaner, and has hot water.

Reviews.Title: “Troubles with the Park Hotel in Belgravia”
Reviews.Author: babs2190
Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel in a row of renovated townhouses. The renovations created tiny little rooms with very little air in them. The beds were mattresses set on what seemed to be boxes. The bathroom was a prefabricated unit that was inserted into a small room and had barely enough room to stand in. When you took a shower, the toilet and the floor were soaked with water. The room was airless, but it was fairly quiet, and it was clean. The shower curtain was filthy but the staff did change it two days after they were asked. Not a place we would return to. Even though the price was low, it still wasn't worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Booked a Double Room, got a Bunk Bed”
Reviews.Author: Michiel096
Reviews.Content: I booked a Double Twin Room, more than 4 months in advance. When we got there, we got a small attic room (ca 2 by 2.5 metres) with a bunk bed, that smelled unpleasantly even after cleaning. The condition of the room was poor, the TV was broken (unless you wanted to hold you finger on the canal switch all the time). In spite of my complaints, they would not give me another room, claiming the hotel was full. Afterwards they told Hotels.com that there were several other rooms available but that I had refused them. A final word about safety: the fire exit was locked. There was a sign advising to smash the door's window. This window however was of armoured glass. The hotel staff denied that the fire exit was locked - of course.

Reviews.Title: “No way, man”
Reviews.Author: Krynnl
Reviews.Content: This place is a dump like no other. It is truly amazing how little the owners are willing to spend on upkeep. For example, the first room they put us in had three beds crammed into it. All the beds were very different in style and appeared to have been purchased at a yard sale. In addition, there were two mismatched end tables with most of the knobs missing. In this room that was supposed to sleep five people, there was a bathroom that was literally about 2 feet wide by 5 feet long including the shower stall and toilet. If you are even slightly chubby, you won't be able to get in there and close the door. The last night they asked us to move because they wanted that room and they actually managed to put us in one that was worse if you can believe it. It was so small that there was no place to put your luggage except on the bed. In this one the bathroom was now 3 feet by 3 feet. The location is great and I thought the management was pleasant but other than that, it reeked.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel in the world”
Reviews.Author: sandersandrew
Reviews.Content: Spacious, clean, vibrant, hygenic and pleasant are words often used to describe hotels. Unfortunately none apply to the Park Hotel. You know when you read sites like trip advisor and you assume that "well, only people who really liked or really hated a hotel are going to post anything" so you can probably take their reviews with a pinch of salt? Yeah? Not one review I have read on this site even comes close to describing the horror of this place. We booked it to have a hotel near to victoria station, therefore handy for the underground. It was, to be fair, quite close to victoria station, although at least 15 hotels are closer. We found our room, un-cleaned at 3pm, to be about as big as most standard box rooms in student flats. The TV was hanging onto the wall for dear life by a bracket that doubled as a wardrobe. There was a gap of about 2 inches between the bed and the walls. The bathroom was essentially a large plastic sink, walled into the corner of an already small room with the pleasant odour of mildew eminating from within. The hot water outlet had no tap, so just poured out onto the floor. The shower took around 15 minutes to warm up. Unfortunately to leave the shower running for 15 minutes meant that the badly fitted shower curtain blocked the plug hole, flooding the bathroom and dripping on the unfortunate souls below you. If you wanted to play a practical joke on someone, you might book them a week in the park. There must be somewhere in the region of 10,000 hotels in London and I wouldn't bet that each of them is better than the Park. Do not, under any circumstances, stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy, horrible, small the worst adjectives to describe a place that should be”
Reviews.Author: mariloli
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel I have ever been in my life, filthy, disgusting, horrible, the receptionman rude, breakfast ... no comment. DON'T GO if you respect yopurselves.Lola. Spain

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Rotten Stinky Smelly Hole!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: DANIELLAM722
Reviews.Content: do not stay in this hotel as it is the worst i have ever seen in my life it is filthy rotten stinking i wouldnt even let my dog stay in it the beds where stained the toilet you could not see any white at the bottom of it. It is a pokey hole with no room staff werent helpful they where checky sent us to a room downstairs in the basement with a baby and didnt even help with our luggage and babys pram. View was a brick wall. We requested a cot as it said we could on the website but when we got there there was no cot and when i asked they said we dont have cots we decided to leave after half an hour at the most and they only give us half our money back they just expected my 7 month old baby to sleep in a bed. STAY CLEAR OF THIS HOTEL!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: tidibee
Reviews.Content: It was horrible!!! We decided to stay in London for a weekend. I booked this hotel one week in advance but when we arrived we were told that they never received our reservation and donâ€™t have any room for us. The only thing they could do is to keep our luggage till evening and call for a cab that we could drive around London looking for place to stay!!! We could not find anything everything was booked. Late in the evening we came back to pick up our luggages and suddenly miracles happens they received our reservation just 10 min. ago and out of the blue they have room for us. What a liars !!! They had rooms available since morning, they were trying to get higher rate from other people who were willing to pay more. Clerk told us, that they are there just to make money!!! SO BE CAREFUL, EVEN YOU HAVE RESERVATION IT DOES NOT MEAN THAT YOU WILL HAVE A ROOM.

Reviews.Title: “Smelly and disgusting”
Reviews.Author: Bottlebrush21
Reviews.Content: This stay was booked through lastminute.com. We were supposed to stay in the Hotel Carbigoe but for some reason, which was not explained, we were sent across the road to the Park Hotel. We only wanted a place to sleep for one night and the offer seemed good at 44.55GBP. The room was tiny, damp, mouldy and overnight the dingy little bathroom stated to smell. Eventually the smell woke us up and we left immediately at 07.00. I have stayed in hotels all over the US and Europe. This was bat far the worst hotel I have ever seen. There was no point in complaining because the staff spoke very little English and did not care. Do not book this hotel or it's sister hotel, the Hotel Carbigoe unless you wish to be miserable!

Reviews.Title: “Rotten, Putrid, Digusting, Dirty 'Hotel'”
Reviews.Author: globetrotters101
Reviews.Content: We had a late night out and last minute decided to stay in a hotel around the SW1 area. The first place we try is the Corbigoe Hotel, 101 Belgrave Road. They tell my partner it will Â£95 to stay the one night. After a 3 mintue haggle, we managed to get it down to Â£45. We weren't expecting much, just a place to lie our heads down for the night with the basic needs one expects in a country such as England. So, we were told to walk down to number 64 Belgrave road...which was indeed the Park Hotel. We were 'greeted' by a very rude Pakistani man who tried to say the agreed price was not Â£45 but higher and was playing games. As it was 3:00 am we were not in the mood for this, we just wanted to sleep...however, we insisted he calls his colleague at the Corbigoe Hotel. He reluctantly did so and then mumbles to us 'ok , but three pounds extra for paying by debit card'. 'Hmm' we thought, ok fine , whatever. So we get given our key to room 205 (right next door to reception) Once we entered that room, we could not believe our eyes. You could argue: well what do u expect if u pay Â£45 for a hotel in central London. But this is no exaggeration, this place was a flea pit, stinking, crumbling, health hazardous hell hole of a room. We actaully laughed in disbelief. Then we opened a scummy looking door to what the hotel refers to as the bathroom. Imagine you are in Delhi, find the most poverty-stricken neighbourhood you can find, then go into the dirtiest looking restaurant u can find then ask to use the 'bathroom''. I could safely say hand on my heart, the bathroom in Delhi would be cleaner and more efficient than this one in London, at the Park Hotel. I immediately pulled the bed sheets off as I expected them to also be filthy. This is the only aspect whichI was not horrified at. The bed linen was relatively clean and fresh smelling. After seeing the room how it was I expected the bed linen be soiled in something nasty to keep in theme with the rest of the room. Phew, we thought, maybe we could just survive it until check out at noon. As we got ready for bed, and took our socks off we suddenly felt that our feet were damp. The carpet in the room was sopping wet! I knelt down to see if it was cleaning solution but instead I got a whiff of a rancid stench. Yummy! The only place I felt relatively safe was in the bed, but with the worry that the light which was directly above our bed , which was hanging by a string and could potentially drop at any moment and kill us! After actually dismantling the light ourselves so we could rest, we prepared to sleep. At around 5 am we were woken to the sounds of doors banging and people leaving and various other peculiar sounds. This was not really a big deal to me. I am still in shock how a hotel of this atrocious standard can be allowed to take business as it really is not only below standard, it is seriously dangerous. We checked out a noon which was the agreed time and we were aggresively asked by the man at reception to pay Â£10 for checking out 'late' .Needless to say there was no way were were parting with more money. This place is not worth even 2 pence for a years stay. I said to the man how shocked I was that this hotel can exist how it is, not to mention putting their prices at Â£95 before negotation. He then shouted back at me that I should stay at the holiday inn if I wanted a shower that worked. Hmm, interesting. We have found the whole experience quite amusing, what else can u do? I am just writing this so that anyone thinking of using this hotel, my advice.... you would be better off buying a sleeping bag from millets and finding yourself a park bench. You'd have fresh air, it's free (minus the sleeping bag cost) and you'd be cleaner by not washing in this hotel, and even if you stay in the clothes you have been wearing for over a month, walked through a swamp, and rolled around in pigs pooh....You'd still be cleaner and have had a more pleasent experience than at this DUMP of a 'hotel' Dont stay at this dreadful place! It is disgusting!!!!

Reviews.Title: “hotel from hell”
Reviews.Author: cactusjac
Reviews.Content: After arriving on friday night we were shown to a room which was cramped, broken television on floor, dirty etc, but as we were late we decided we only needed a bed for night and would not be there for most of the day! We went to sleep reluctantly and were woken in the night by water pouring down the walls and coming through the ceiling. my partner myself and our 2 children plus clothes and luggage were soaked, then fire alarm went off and we were told not to worry. Manager was extremely rude and told us we would have to pay HIM!!! TO BE MOVED ROOMS. This hotel is a death trap and somebody is going to be kiiled, staff didnt care and we left the hotel and had to find another hotel. We moved next door to the Sidney Hotel which was very pleasant which I would recommend. Please don't stay in this hotel enviromental health should shut this hell hole down

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away!!”
Reviews.Author: Cessa
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 2 nights with my boyfriend, -and will never go back! The [-] started when we checked in at the hotel: We were met by the recepsjonist. It was a friendly tone in the beginning. I said friendly: please give us a nice room. The recepsjonist replyed with that if we wanted a nice room, we should rather stay at the other hotel the manager had, which was just across the street. We acceptet this, and went for 300 meters to this other hotel. At his hotel, the manager and the recepsjonist discussed for a while, and tried to give us a room at the basement, and said that we had to change room on the following day. We also had to pay 10Â£ extra for breakfast, since this was another hotel. We did not want to sleep in the basement, and so i told them. Then they gave us another room, which was not a proper hotel room, but a storage-room, with 6 beds -up side down (!!) in the 4th floor. We went back and told them that we not willing to organise our own hotel room, and wantet a double room as we reserved. At the hotel we booked at. -So we went back (another 300m) to the Park Hotel, and they said that they did not have a double room left, but wanted to give a trippel room. The room we got was dirty, and the double bed was not a proper bed, but a bed made of two different sized bunks. The result was that the bed went down in bouth ends, and gave us a headich while sleeping. The window and curtains was really dirty. The bathroom was discusting. It was a not nice room, and so I told them. The recepsjonist replied with that we had to pay another 20Â£ if we wanted to eat breakfast there.... To sum up: a horrible place with horrible management!! Stay away!!

Reviews.Title: “Depressed by this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Traveler_BE
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this Hotel to anyone! We were cramped up the 5th floor in a bunk bedroom which was more like a storage room. It was very very small and we couldn't even sit in the room or move. After complaining we got a larger room, which was nice in space, but not very clean. Towels were not refreshed and the bed poorly made. The bathroom seems to have served on an airplane! Too small to even move or go to the toilet properly. Breakfast was very simple, but there isn't enough room to sit for eveye guest at once, so at times people would bump into you. Also the dishes were not very clean and reservation papers / crates / junk / ... was all around the "breakfast room" (which was also the reception! Anyway, VERY small as you understand). The people at the hotel were sometimes nice, but most of the time I got the impression they didn't really care. In short : please do not go there ! spent you're hard earned money elsewhere ...

Reviews.Title: “This is not an hotel”
Reviews.Author: jmcmik
Reviews.Content: My fiancÃ©e and I went to this hotel in 2005! I never saw such an ugly hotel with such rude people!!! I cannot even explain what we lived there! First we had to sleep in another hotel in the same street. We told the man in the second hotel that we had paid to seelp in the park hotel, so we went back to the Park Hotel and said that we wanted to stay in the hotel we paid for! The man finally accepted and gave us a VERY dirty room! I had never seen such a room of my entire life : the TV didn't work, the dust was everywhere, the furniture was broken, the bathroom was destroyed and dangerous for feet and the window was just in frot of the garbbages... We went to the frontdesk and complained. We didn't pay something like $250 to sleep in such a room! The man became very very rude and he told us that he didn't wants us to stay at his hotel, we could look for another hotel! It was 09:00 pm... before that we paid for the breakfast in cash, then we changed our mind, but he refused to pay us back. Of course he refused to pay our 2 nights off. We had to look for another hotel and we found an "expensive" nice hotel, we had no choice as we were expelled from the hotel just because we wanted to sleep in the hotel we paid for! We wrote the travel website we used to book the 2 nights and thanks to the pictures we had taken and the poor "reputation" of this hotel, this website accepted to pay the 2 night nights in the new hotel where we slept! If I were you, I wouldn't sleep in the Park Hotel. The people there just want to take YOUR money, they don't care about the tourists, they are liars and cheaters! It was the worst experience of my tourist life! It had to be a romantic getaway, but it began the worst way possible! Don't go there! NB : Sorry for my English.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay In This Terrible Hotel/ No Service”
Reviews.Author: indoboy25
Reviews.Content: Hello, We stayed in June 2006 in this Horrible hotel. The rooms are very small, old, not clean, window dirty, you could not look outside. The hotel owners were rude, we got not service from them, they only wanted our money. When we checked out we kept our bags in the hotel for a couple of ours and we had to pay for 2 suitcases 5 pound, THIS IS NOT NORMAL. When we came back, the owner asked us for a gift! So rude! He had to give us money for staying in this HELL HOTEL. In prison you get better BREAKFAST! In the breakfast room were a lot of bugs, so nasty! I WILL NEVER STAY IN THIS HELL HOTEL AGAIN. IT IS A ONE STAR HOTEL, BET THEY NOT EVER DESERVE THE ONE STAR! DO NOT STAY IN THIS HOTEL!

Reviews.Title: “Not even one night”
Reviews.Author: sandcove
Reviews.Content: Introduction: Iâ€™ve been to London several times therefore I know a decent hotel can be quite expensive. However, this time in April I just needed a hotel for one night (I paid about USD$ 80.- for one night) because I had a flight early in the morning leaving from London Gatwick. I read the very negative reviews on tripadvisor beforehand and thought it canâ€™t be so bad for just one night. I was wrong! Hotel location: The hotel is located in a quiet area about a 15min walk from Victoria Station (Underground, Railway, Gatwick Express). Hotel room: There is no elevator; I had to haul my suitcase up a narrow staircase which is very exhausting. The room is super-small, there is no cupboard or shelf to put the luggage or any other things. The bed mattress is poor quality, when lying on the bed I felt every single mattress spring and could hardly sleep. There is no bedside table also the phone was simply on the carpet beside the bed. The bathroom is very tiny even brushing the teeth is difficult to accomplish. I did without taking a shower because I was afraid I may get stuck in the tiny bathroom. Summary: The hotel is very poor quality therefore I can only advise against staying in the Park Hotel. I only wonder why this hotel is bookable through international hotel reservation agencies. Such a hotel should not be listed in international hotel databases.

Reviews.Title: “great for location, awful for staying in!”
Reviews.Author: lou245
Reviews.Content: Park Hotel is located in a great area, really near Victoria station, so its really easy to get around london BUT i have to warn that this hotel is possibly the most depressing hotel I have ever stayed in! To be fair, the people who ran it were lovely to us from start to finish but the rooms were awful. Me and my partner ended up popping to victoria station to use the toilets as the smell was awful coming from them! The bedlinen was clean and changed in the morning but there were dubious stains on the oversheets the walls as well as what looked like dog hair all over the floor! The plugs were dangerously wired with exposed wires and scorch marks etc...the window was also missing the handles so we couldnt shut it! not too good considering the noisy road below! We avoided breakfast as we couldnt really stomach it so i cant vouch for the food there. sounds snobby but we went expected a 3 star hotel and ended up in something more like a hostel. Was booked as a surprise birthday present and to be honest my partner who'd organised the trip was gutted! In defense of the hotel the staff were nothing but helpful, almost apologetic for the hotel itself and the beds were comfy and you are located so centrally its ideal if youre exhausted and simply need somewhere cheap to sleep but do not visit there if your staying any longer than one night as you will be sorely dissapointed!

Reviews.Title: “holiday hotel hell”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I cannot say one good thing about the park hotel, on our arival we were made to walk to another hotel in the rain, after an already long journey. The people were rude and didnt speak much English, The rooms were very unclean, there was even sick on one of the beds when we arived, and the staff seamed shocked when we asked them to change it. I found clumps of hair on the carpet and in the beds and the room smelt of cheep bleach. i would advise people to stay away from the park hotel as it was the very low point of my holiday. if people are wanting to stay in a cheap hotel in london i would say to them "look else were" the park hotel RUINED MY HOLIDAY!.

Reviews.Title: “hotel from hell”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: where do i start we checked in at 2 30 and was very disappointed with the room we had booked a triple room and we could not move it was 1 single and then 2 singles pushed together when we sat on the beds they shook we looked underneath and it was frames of thin wood banged together with matresses on top there was no where to hang clothes and they had to stay in the case the sheets were clean but the top cover was dirty looking the en suite was disgusting the shower head was filthy and had tape round it the handle to put the shower on was broke and taped up the sink was dirty and both shower and sink had alot of lime scale on them we were very unhappy but as they has made us pay when we came in we had no choice but to stay we then went straight out my 14 yr old twins were very unhappy the best is yet to come my daughter left her new phone in the room when we got back it had gone no one new where it was and the staff were terrible all they kept saying is nothing like this has happened before and said no one had been in the room but we new they had because we left a cup on the window and it was gone and the window open then two days later we set a trap we put earrings down and took a photo suprise suprise when we got back they had gone as well but once again nobody new i asked the cleaner she didnt no and when you went to reception all they would do was grin at you our overall stay was disgusting and we will never go to this hotel again and if you want a good trip dont stay here oh and by the way the fone was switched on the day after we got home and eveytime i rang it they turned it off but just to let the person who stole my 14 yr olds fone and earrings we have had the sim card cancelled and the fone blacklisted my only thought is has any one else had any thing stolen from this hotel and by the way the picture that they have on the sites is not the park hotel and it looks nothing like that inside a very angry mum and we have photos that we will add soon

Reviews.Title: “I would not recommend to anyone.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is small and dirty. We booked via the internet and was not expecting anything too glam but at least something clean. The shower and toilet were discusting. We actualy didnt stay there we checked into another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “All you need.”
Reviews.Author: FrederickAlexander
Reviews.Content: It all depends on your expectations. We were in London for one week, and all we needed was a bed to sleep in. Your not supposed to hang around at the hotel when you're in London. We went out in the city in the morning. the Victoria St. is nearby with all its tube-lines. And stayed out until the afternoon, took a shower and went out for the evening. We didn't have any problems with the hotel at all, and they were smiling at us in the reception.

Reviews.Title: “The Folks Living on the Embankment in Cardboard Boxes Get A Better Deal”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The room was tiny and dirty. The bedlinen had stains on it. The windows were filthy and let in a draught. The laminate flooring didn't fit the room and so there were many cracks in it at the edges. The radiator was cold but nevertheless made banging noises. Already I was regretting booking this awful place. The coffee facilities did not include sugar and when I asked for some was told 'five minutes'. However, two hours later it hadn't arrived. Whether it would ever have come or not I do not know. The final straw was when I went to the loo (which was in a room with a shower and was in total no larger than a coach toilet) and after doing the necessary, could not locate any loo paper. In addition, there was only one towel - a small hand towel which would have made it tricky to dry oneself after a shower - assuming the shower worked of course, which based on the rest of the facilities was probably very doubtful. The sink was filthy and had red stains, the origin of which makes the mind boggle. No way was I prepared to stay in this place overnight, even though I had paid upfront for three nights - so I left.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Park Hotel over Christmas and were pleased with the room and both the price and the location were great. Really great value too! We booked our room on the internet and it was exactly what we had expected, a budget hotel. We travelled with our 16 and 10 year old children and were travelling on a tight budget. This was a nice inexpensive hotel and catered well to our family - the front desk reception was very helpful to us througout our stay. The rooms were comfortable and suited us perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “Do not ruin your vacation!!! Warning”
Reviews.Author: carlosedo79
Reviews.Content: WARNING!!! DO NOT RUIN YOUR TRIP!!! I have been in many bad hotels, but this is by far the worst of all. First, we had to pay to the man at the desk, according to the contract. After he had our money, he said he could not find the room key and sent us to another hotel. We were not the only. Some days afterwards, the man was playing the same game with other guests. The next day, we got a little, dirty, dark and cold room at the basement. It was really filthy and the bathroom was not bigger than an airplane toilet, besides, the plane's is cleaner and has not roaches. The breakfast is included in the price, but the whole place was so dirty that we could not take it there. The only good point is that the hotel is so disgusting that we avoided as much as possible going there; so, we visited many places in London. Even so, we had to spend the night there, and then, the real torture began. There were no blankets, just a sheet, with hair from former users, and a cover with spots whose origin I do not want to imagine. Besides, the radiator does not work and we had to sleep with all our clothes. The services offered in the web site are not actually provided by the hotel and the staff doesn't care about any request from the guests. These people has no sense of ethics.

Reviews.Title: “The worse hotel ever!!!! Please don't book here”
Reviews.Author: Solyluna
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this terrible hotel 4 nights. When we arrived, they made us pay first, then said that they had lost the key to the room and sent us some other place. The next day they gave us an awfully cold room (no blankets) with bugs and extremely dirty (no cleaning of the bathroom, didn't change the bed sheets from the previews guests). The staff is very careless and just don't care at all about their customers needs. They say they have internet access, which is not true, and also that they are less than 5 minutes away from the Victoria Station when they are more than 20 minutes away by foot. Please think twice or even more before booking at this horrible place.

Reviews.Title: “A Dump!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Beware, prices may be low, but try something else! I made the reservations almost three months before through an internet site IÂ´ve used several times before with good results. When we came to the Park Hotel we met a rather surly gentleman who didnÂ´t seem especially interested in having us as his guests. After IÂ´d registered he asked whether we would like breakfast, as, he said, this was not included in the price weÂ´d already paid through the internet site. Unfortunately I had not printed all the information from the site, because there it said clearly that breakfast was included. Breakfast would be (after a while of thinking) five pounds a day for the two of us. As we didnÂ´t att all like the look of the premises we saw behind the little reception area (looked like a tiny breakfast room, dark and dirty), we said no thanks. All of a sudden there was some problem with our room and he said he would have to send us down the road to another hotel. We didnÂ´t object as we thought the alternative could hardly be worse than the Park Hotel. So we wound up att the Carbigoe Hotel att 101 Belgrave Road. There we met the only positive part of the whole experience: a rather nice gentleman in the reception. The room was tiny, the shower certainly had both hot and cold water, but the water came mainly out of the tubing as the showerhead was clogged. Two out of four lights in the room and bathroom worked. The bed did have clean sheets, but the rest of the room was dirty, wall-to-wall carpeting of dubious colour, drapes that were graying from dust, ingrown dirt in the bathroom; no one knows what hid under the bed, we certainly didnÂ´t look and IÂ´m quite sure nobody else has for years and years. In spite of it all (and thanks to the clean sheets!) we decided to stay the two nights weÂ´d already paid for and not let the sorry state of the hotel destroy our visit to London, rather take it as a lesson for the future. But please, if you can avoid our mistake, search for another hotel, there are lots of them i London, not all clean, but hardly any in sorrier state than the Park-Carbigoe!

Reviews.Title: “The Park Hotel, Nightmare in London”
Reviews.Author: robbyo
Reviews.Content: We found our hotel which was nothing like the description on the Expedia site. It was, at that time, described as a cosy, family run Hotel. It was dingy and small and had no heat, We had booked a month early and Expedia had charged us the rent in advance otherwise we would have left and found some place else. They tried to give us a room in the basement we argued with them and then they tried to put us into a room on the first floor. That room was small with a double bed filling the space. The room had a narrow corridoe leading to a grimy window looking out to a light shaft. The corridor was being used to store, upended single beds, making it impossible to get to the window. We finally got a room on the third floor overlooking the grimy rooftops. Of course no lift. The room was dirty the window was so filthy that you could hardly look out of it. The blankets were so dirty we wouldn't sleep under them. The room was freezing cold. We went out for some supper and I told the receptionist that the radiator wasn't working and she assured me she would have someone fix it. When we returned to the room it was still icy cold and the radiator was like a fridge. I went back down to the reeception to encounter a new person who informed me that they can't get an electrician at night....the radiator is supposed to be steam. He offered to give me an extra blanket. We couldn't/wouldn't use the filthy one we already had. I noticed the reception area was toasty warm and saw that it was being warmed by a couple of electric heaters. I demanded one of the them and he agreed and actually carried it up to the room and plugged it in. We spent the night, fully clothed lying on top of the bed. The shower was so small and filthy we wouldn't use it and the toilet flushed only after repeated flushing. We certainly suggest that if anyone is considering this hotel...don't.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: All the other reviews seem to be telling the truth, pay a bit extra and stay somewhere else .Oh and yes there are bed bugs.

Reviews.Title: “Stay in a Park instead”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stay somewhere else, please!
